-2-
You are my wife. Since you have had the rightful trust in me, have looked after me for my welfare, have been my helper and advocate in every way, and have been doing my service, I, out of my natural affection for you and considering love as a reward, and with the intention of providing you with some fixed income, have acquired from my ancestors, the vacant land in the third paragraph of the schedule below, which is worth Rs. 81,000/- in words, and which is in my complete possession till today, and therefore, with all my rights and all the feudal restrictions of my nation, without any reward and without any reward, have considered love as a reward, and have freely transferred it to you by virtue of this settlement deed. It is hereby taken over by you immediately. You shall be the sole owner of the entire property, and you shall enjoy eternal happiness with the rights of gift, sale and inheritance of your son, grandson, and descendants. I shall never have any dispute with you or your heirs or with my heirs regarding this property. It does not belong to the Government or any Government institution. No leases have ever been given to any such institution. This property is not a vested property as per the Ordinance No. 2 of 9/77 of the Government of Sri Andhra Pradesh. I hereby write and issue this Settlement Deed in your name, assuring you that there are no other mortgages or other encumbrances on this property, and that in the future, if any disputes or disputes arise from anyone, all such disputes will be settled on my own responsibility and with the help of other assets I have, and that I will be able to execute and issue this Settlement Deed in your name without any delay. Vaigala SurelSheet Endorsement

sections.content: The property covered under Gift Settlement Deed No. 429 of 2026, dated 29/Jan/2026, executed by Vygala Suresh in favour of his wife, Vygala Jagadeeswaramma, towards the property admeasuring an extent of 61.66Sq.Yds., comprised in survey number 85 situated in Nimmalavalasa Village, Chipurupalli Mandal, within the District of Vizianagaram registered at sub-registrar office Chipurupalli (203) is bounded as follows: North by: Vacant site of Budumuru Appalaswami South by: 7 feet Way East by: Vacant site of Budumuru Appalaswami West by: RCC Slab House of Kanuri Varma Note:[*Schedule property is part of Gramakantam as per recitals of the deed.]
It is noted from the given documents and EC that the schedule property is not part of any active Mortgage or Lease Deed.

Note:It is to be noted that the online EC has been verified using the key parameters, namely the Document Number and Survey Number of the concerned SRO, as per the Deed. However, cross-verification across multiple SROs has not been carried out due to the AP portal’s requirement of separate passwords for each search parameter, and the OTP-based authentication mechanism makes searches across multiple SROs operationally infeasible.
